      function OptanonWrapper() {
        var user = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('userDetails')) || {};
        const id = user.id ? user.id : window['pendo'].get_visitor_id();
        const firstName = user.first_name;
        const lastName = user.last_name;
        let targetingCookieValue;
        let dnpValue;
        const dataLayer = window.dataLayer;
        const GroupsArr = dataLayer?.filter((item) => item.event === 'OneTrustGroupsUpdated');
        console.log(window.dataLayer);
        if (GroupsArr?.length > 1) {
          const previousCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 2]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          const updatedCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 1]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          let FunctionalCategoryChanged;
          let TargetingCategoryChanged;
          const previousCLC003Exist = previousCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') > -1;
          const updatedCLC003Exist = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') > -1;
          if (previousCLC003Exist && !updatedCLC003Exist) {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = true;
            dnpValue = true;
          } else if (!previousCLC003Exist && updatedCLC003Exist) {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = true;
            dnpValue = false;
          } else {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = false;
          }

          const previousCLC004Exist = previousCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') > -1;
          const updatedCLC004Exist = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') > -1;
          if (previousCLC004Exist && !updatedCLC004Exist) {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = true;
            targetingCookieValue = 'NO';
          } else if (!previousCLC004Exist && updatedCLC004Exist) {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = true;
            targetingCookieValue = 'YES';
          } else {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = false;
          }

          if (FunctionalCategoryChanged) {
            callDNP(id, dnpValue, user.session);
          } else if (updatedCLC003Exist) {
            console.log('0003 on');
            initializePendo();
          }
          if (TargetingCategoryChanged) {
            /* this timeout is added because Pendo allows only one API call per second per visitor */
            setTimeout(() => {
              updateCustomMetadataField(id, targetingCookieValue, user.session);
            }, 2000);
          }

        } else if (GroupsArr?.length === 1) {
          const updatedCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 1]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          dnpValue = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') === -1;
          targetingCookieValue = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') === -1 ? 'NO' : 'YES';
          createVisitorId(firstName, lastName, id, dnpValue, targetingCookieValue, user.session);
        }
      };

    function createVisitorId(firstName, lastName, visitorId, dnpValue, targetingCookieValue, sid) {
      console.log('pendo create visitor');
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/createVisistor', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify([{
          visitorId,
          values: {
            firstname: firstName,
            lastname: lastName
          }
        }])
      });

      fetch(request)
        .then(async response => {
          if (response.status === 200) {
            callDNP(visitorId, dnpValue, sid);
            setTimeout(() => {
              updateCustomMetadataField(visitorId, targetingCookieValue, sid);
            }, 2000);
          }
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }

    function callDNP(visitorId, dnpValue, sid) {
      const params = {
        'visitorId': visitorId,
        'dnpValue': dnpValue
      };
      console.log('pendo callDNP');
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/dnp', {
        method: 'PUT',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify(params)
      });

      fetch(request)
        .then(async response => {
          if (!dnpValue) {
            window['pendo'] && window['pendo'].startGuides();
            initializePendo();
          } else {
             window['pendo'] && window['pendo'].stopGuides();
          }
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }

    function getHeader(sid) {
      const headers = new Headers();
      headers.append('Content-Type', 'application/json');
      headers.append('SID', sid);
      return headers;
    }

    function initializePendo() {
      console.log('pendo initialize');
      var user = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('userDetails')) || {};
      window.pendo.initialize({
        visitor: {
          id: user.id ? user.id : window['pendo'].get_visitor_id(),
          truid: user.truid,
          email: user.email,
          full_name: user.full_name,
          session: user.session,
          sp: user.sp,
          interface_language: user.lang,
          entitlements: user.entitlements
        },
        account: {
          id: user.customerId,
          name: user.name,
          environment: user.environment
        }
      });
    }

    function updateCustomMetadataField(visitorId, targetingCookieValue, sid) {
      console.log('pendo update Target');
      const params = {
        'targetingCookieValue': targetingCookieValue,
        'visitorId': visitorId,
      };
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/updateMetaData', {
        method: 'PUT',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify(params)
      });

      fetch(request)
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }</script><style>.section-with-left-nav header{display:flex;justify-content:center;margin:0 .9375rem}.section-with-left-nav header _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-152-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-152-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2162-8742&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ECS SOLID STATE LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-152-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-152-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 4 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.R27-R30 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec152AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Eight-segment LED displays were designed and fabricated using <mark>quantum</mark> dot light-emitting diodes. CdSe/CdS/ZnS core/shell <mark>quantum</mark> dot were employed as the emitting layer sandwiched by poly(N,NI-bis(4-butylpheny1)-N,N/-bis(phenyl)benzidine) (PolyTPD) and an electron transport layer of ZnO nanoparticles. Each segment exhibited luminance, power efficiency and external <mark>quantum</mark> efficiency of 5380 cd/</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-153-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-153-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0036-8075&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SCIENCE" data-ta="Sidenav-153-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-153-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 325 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5937) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.178-181 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec153AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Three-dimensional topological insulators are a new state of <mark>quantum</mark> matter with a bulk gap and odd number of relativistic Dirac fermions on the surface. By investigating the surface state of Bi2Te3 with angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy, we demonstrate that the surface state consists of a single nondegenerate Dirac cone. Furthermore, with appropriate hole doping, the Fermi level can be </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record153">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" pp.1-45 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec154AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The nitrogen-vacancy (NV) colour centre in diamond is an important physical system for emergent <mark>quantum</mark> technologies, including <mark>quantum</mark> metrology, information processing and communications, as well as for various nanotechnologies, such as biological and sub-diffraction limit imaging, and for tests of entanglement in <mark>quantum</mark> mechanics. Given this array of existing and potential applications and </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record154">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-156-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-156-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0002-7863&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY" data-ta="Sidenav-156-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-156-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 138 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (18) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.5797-5800 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec156AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Highly luminescent covalent organic frameworks (COFs) are rarely achieved because of the aggregation-caused quenching (ACQ) of pi-pi stacked layers. Here, we report a general strategy to design highly emissive COFs by introducing an aggregation-induced emission (AIE) mechanism. The integration of AIE-active units into the polygon vertices yields crystalline porous COFs with periodic pi-stacked </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-0132&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO TODAY" data-ta="Sidenav-158-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-158-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 9 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.590-603 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec158AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Carbon dots represent an emerging class of fluorescent materials and provide a broad application potential in various fields of biomedicine and optoelectronics. In this review, we introduce various synthetic strategies and basic photoluminescence properties of carbon dots, and then address their advanced in vitro and in vivo bioapplications including cell imaging, photoacoustic imaging, photody</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1476-1122&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-159-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-159-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 14 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (3) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.301-306 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec159AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The advent of graphene and related 2D materials1,2 has recently led to a new technology: heterostructures based on these atomically thin crystals(3). The paradigm proved itself extremely versatile and led to rapid demonstration of tunnelling diodes with negative differential resistance(4), tunnelling transistors(5), photovoltaic devices(6,7) and so on. Here, we take the complexity and functiona</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" </td><!----></tr><!----></table><div _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-161-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-161-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0926-3373&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=APPLIED CATALYSIS B-ENVIRONMENTAL" data-ta="Sidenav-161-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-161-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 219 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.693-704 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec161AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Mimicking the natural photosynthesis, artificial Z-scheme photocatalysis enables more efficient utilization of solar energy for sustainable chemical fuel production. Herein, a direct Z-scheme g-C3N4/WO3 photocatalyst with host-guest architecture is rationally designed, demonstrating significantly enhanced activities of photocatalytic H-2 production. Unprecedented atomic-scale imaging of both th</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-162-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-162-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0036-8075&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SCIENCE" data-ta="Sidenav-162-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-162-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 332 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6031) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.805-809 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec162AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Comparing photosynthetic and photovoltaic efficiencies is not a simple issue. Although both processes harvest the energy in sunlight, they operate in distinctly different ways and produce different types of products: biomass or chemical fuels in the case of natural photosynthesis and nonstored electrical current in the case of photovoltaics. In order to find common ground for evaluating energy-</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record162">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-163-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-163-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-163-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-163-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 535 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7610) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.127-130 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec163AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Photon emitters placed in an optical cavity experience an environment that changes how they are coupled to the surrounding light field. In the weak-coupling regime, the extraction of light from the emitter is enhanced. But more profound effects emerge when single-emitter strong coupling occurs: mixed states are produced that are part light, part matter(1,2), forming building blocks for <mark>quantum</mark> </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-164-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-164-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2050-7526&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF MATERIALS CHEMISTRY C" data-ta="Sidenav-164-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-164-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 5 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (10) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.2488-2503 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec164AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The recent chemical exfoliation of layered MAX phase compounds to novel two-dimensional transition metal carbides and nitrides, the so-called MXenes, has brought a new opportunity to materials science and technology. This review highlights the computational attempts that have been made to understand the <mark>physics</mark> and chemistry of this very promising family of advanced two-dimensional materials, a</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0935-9648&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-165-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-165-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 30 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (13) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec165AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Carbon dots (CDs) have significant potential for use in various fields including biomedicine, bioimaging, and optoelectronics. However, inefficient excitation and emission of CDs in both near-infrared (NIR-I and NIR-II) windows remains an issue. Solving this problem would yield significant improvement in the tissue-penetration depth for in vivo bioimaging with CDs. Here, an NIR absorption band </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-166-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-166-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-3387&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE NANOTECHNOLOGY" data-ta="Sidenav-166-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-166-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 9 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (4) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.262-267 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec166AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The p-n junction is the functional element of many electronic and optoelectronic devices, including diodes, bipolar transistors, photodetectors, light-emitting diodes and solar cells. In conventional p-n junctions, the adjacent p-and n-type regions of a semiconductor are formed by chemical doping. Ambipolar semiconductors, such as carbon nanotubes1, nano-wires(2) and organic molecules(3), allow</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-167-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-167-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1433-7851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ANGEWANDTE CHEMIE-INTERNATIONAL EDITION" data-ta="Sidenav-167-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-167-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 55 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (25) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.7231-7235 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec167AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Photoluminescence (PL), up-conversion PL (UCPL), and phosphorescence are three kinds of phenomena common to light-emitting materials, but it is very difficult to observe all of them simultaneously when they are derived from a single material at room temperature. For the first time, triple-mode emission (that is, PL, UCPL, and room temperature phosphorescence (RTP)) is reported, which relies on </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-168-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-168-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0002-7863&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY" data-ta="Sidenav-168-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-168-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 125 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (41) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.12567-12575 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec168AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Successive ion layer adsorption and reaction (SILAR) originally developed for the deposition of thin films on solid substrates from solution baths is introduced as a technique for the growth of high-quality core/shell nanocrystals of compound semiconductors. _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-169-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-169-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1476-1122&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-169-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-169-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 10 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (10) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.765-771 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec169AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Colloidal-<mark>quantum</mark>-dot (CQD) optoelectronics offer a compelling combination of solution processing and spectral tunability through <mark>quantum</mark> size effects. So far, CQD solar cells have relied on the use of organic ligands to passivate the surface of the semiconductor nanoparticles. Although inorganic metal chalcogenide ligands have led to record electronic transport parameters in CQD films, no phot</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-170-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-170-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0021-8979&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-170-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-170-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 87 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (3) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.965-1006 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec170AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>During the last few years the developments in the field of III-nitrides have been spectacular. High quality epitaxial layers can now be grown by MOVPE. Recently good quality epilayers have also been grown by MBE. Considerable work has been done on dislocations, strain, and critical thickness of GaN grown on different substrates. Splitting of valence band by crystal field and by spin-orbit inter</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1530-6984&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-171-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-171-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 15 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (8) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.5635-5640 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec171AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Postsynthetic chemical transformations of colloidal nanocrystals, such as ion-exchange reactions, provide an avenue to compositional fine-tuning or to otherwise inaccessible materials and morphologies. While cation-exchange is facile and commonplace, anion-exchange reactions have not received substantial deployment. Here we report fast, low-temperature, deliberately partial, or complete anionex</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-172-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-172-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1433-7851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ANGEWANDTE CHEMIE-INTERNATIONAL EDITION" data-ta="Sidenav-172-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-172-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 54 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (12) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.3653-3657 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec172AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>As a unique two-dimensional nanomaterial, layered black phosphorus (BP) nanosheets have shown promising applications in electronics. Although mechanical exfoliation was successfully used to prepare BP nanosheets, it is still a challenge to produce novel BP nanostructures in high yield. A facile top-down approach for preparation of black phosphorus <mark>quantum</mark> dots (BPQDs) in solution is presented. </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span data-ta="Sidenav-173-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-173-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0926-3373&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=APPLIED CATALYSIS B-ENVIRONMENTAL" data-ta="Sidenav-173-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-173-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 224 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.983-999 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec173AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Graphitic carbon nitride (g-C3N4) is an attractive photocatalyst which has appealing visible light absorption, outstanding layered porous structure, high stability and nontoxicity. Many experimental methods have been developed to modify the pristine g-C3N4 and enhanced photocatalytic activities have been witnessed. First principle calculation based on density functional theory is an effective a</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-174-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-174-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1745-2473&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-174-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-174-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 10 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.343-350 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec174AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The recent emergence of two-dimensional layered materials - in particular the transition metal dichalcogenides - provides a new laboratory for exploring the internal <mark>quantum</mark> degrees of freedom of electrons and their potential for new electronics. These degrees of freedom are the real electron spin, the layer pseudospin, and the valley pseudospin. New methods for the <mark>quantum</mark> control of the spin </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0935-9648&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-175-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-175-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 31 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (36) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec175AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>As one of the most critical approaches to resolve the energy crisis and environmental concerns, carbon dioxide (CO2) photoreduction into value-added chemicals and solar fuels (for example, CO, HCOOH, CH3OH, CH4) has attracted more and more attention. In nature, photosynthetic organisms effectively convert CO2 and H2O to carbohydrates and oxygen (O-2) using sunlight, which has inspired the _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-176-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-176-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0036-8075&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SCIENCE" data-ta="Sidenav-176-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-176-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 297 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5581) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.593-596 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec176AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Fluorescence has been observed directly across the band gap of semiconducting carbon nanotubes. We obtained individual nanotubes, each encased in a cylindrical micelle, by ultrasonically agitating an aqueous dispersion of raw single-walled carbon nanotubes in sodium dodecyl sulfate and then centrifuging to remove tube bundles, ropes, and residual catalyst. Aggregation of nanotubes into bundles </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-177-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-177-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2211-2855&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO ENERGY" data-ta="Sidenav-177-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-177-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 38 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.72-81 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec177AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Graphitic carbon nitride (g-C3N4) has attracted enormous research attention as a promising low cost, visible-light driven semiconductor photocatalyst. However, low photoabsorption efficiencies and unsatisfactory charge separation limit the potential of g-C3N4 in many applications, motivating attempts to manipulate the structure and electronic properties of g-C3N4 to achieve improved performance</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec178AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Lanthanide-doped upconversion nanoparticles (UCNPs) have attracted considerable interest due to their superior physicochemical features, such as large anti-Stokes shifts, low autofluorescence background, low toxicity and high penetration depth, which make them extremely suitable for use as alternatives to conventional downshifting luminescence bioprobes like organic dyes and <mark>quantum</mark> dots for va</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-179-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-179-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0001-4842&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ACCOUNTS OF CHEMICAL RESEARCH" data-ta="Sidenav-179-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-179-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 47 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.612-623 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec179AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Silicon nanomaterials are an important class of nanomaterials with great potential for technologies including energy, catalysis, and biotechnology, because of their many unique properties, including biocompatibility, abundance, and unique electronic, optical, and mechanical properties, among others. Silicon nanomaterials are known to have little or no toxicity due to favorable biocompatibility </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-180-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-180-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2041-1723&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE COMMUNICATIONS" data-ta="Sidenav-180-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-180-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 11 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec180AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Exploring photocatalysts to promote CO2 photoreduction into solar fuels is of great significance. We develop TiO2/perovskite (CsPbBr3) S-scheme heterojunctions synthesized by a facile electrostatic-driven self-assembling approach. Density functional theory calculation combined with experimental studies proves the electron transfer from CsPbBr3 <mark>quantum</mark> dots (QDs) to TiO2, resulting in the constr</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Owing to the good mechanical flexibility and pronounced structure stability of carbon nanocages-encapsulated Co9</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-183-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-183-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0036-8075&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SCIENCE" data-ta="Sidenav-183-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-183-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 318 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5851) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.766-770 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec183AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Recent theory predicted that the <mark>quantum</mark> spin Hall effect, a fundamentally new <mark>quantum</mark> state of matter that exists at zero external magnetic field, may be realized in HgTe/(Hg,Cd)Te <mark>quantum</mark> wells. We fabricated such sample structures with low density and high mobility in which we could tune, through an external gate voltage, the carrier conduction from n-type to p-type, passing through an insul</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-184-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-184-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1936-0851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ACS NANO" data-ta="Sidenav-184-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-184-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 10 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.2071-2081 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec184AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Lead halide perovskite materials have attracted significant attention in the context of photovoltaics and other optoelectronic applications, and recently, research efforts have been directed to nanostructured lead halide perovskites. Collodial nanocrystals (NCs) of cesium lead halides (CsPbX3, X = Cl, Br, I) exhibit bright photoluminescence, with emission tunable over the entire visible spectra</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Over the past several decades, there has been significant progress in manipulating electron spin for semiconductor spintronic devices, motivated by potential spin-based informatio</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-187-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-187-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0021-9517&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF CATALYSIS" data-ta="Sidenav-187-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-187-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 266 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.165-168 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec187AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>To efficiently convert solar energy into chemical energy by artificial photosynthesis, we need to develop visible-light-responsive photocatalysts with a high <mark>quantum</mark> efficiency (QE). Here we report that an artificial photocatalyst (Pt-PdS/CdS) can achieve a QE up to 93% in photocatalytic H-2 production in the presence of sacrificial reagents under visible light irradiation, and is very stable u</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0034-6861&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=REVIEWS OF MODERN PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-188-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-188-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 82 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (3) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.2257-2298 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec188AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Modern nanotechnology allows one to scale down various important devices (sensors, chips, fibers, etc.) and thus opens up new horizons for their applications. The efficiency of most of them is based on fundamental physical phenomena, such as transport of wave excitations and resonances. Short propagation distances make phase-coherent processes of waves important. Often the scattering of waves i</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" This compound is a direct band gap semiconductor which meets most of the requirements for successful detection of X- and gamma-ray radiation, such as high attenuation, high resistivity, and
