_ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-190-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-190-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0031-9007&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-190-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-190-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 95 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (14) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec190AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The <mark>quantum</mark> spin Hall (QSH) phase is a time reversal invariant electronic state with a bulk electronic band gap that supports the transport of charge and spin in gapless edge states. We show that this phase is associated with a novel Z(2) topological invariant, which distinguishes it from an ordinary insulator. The Z(2) classification, which is defined for time reversal invariant Hamiltonians, </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-191-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-191-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1947-5454&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ANNUAL REVIEW OF CONDENSED MATTER PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-191-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-191-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 8 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.337-354 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec191AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Topological insulators and topological semimetals are both new classes of <mark>quantum</mark> materials, which are characterized by surface states induced by the topology of the bulk band structure. Topological Dirac or Weyl semimetals show linear dispersion around nodes, termed the Dirac or Weyl points, as the three-dimensional analog of graphene. We review the basic concepts and compare these topological</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-192-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-192-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0003-6951&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=APPLIED PHYSICS LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-192-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-192-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 64 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (13) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1687-1689 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec192AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Candela-class high-brightness InGaN/AlGaN double-heterostructure (DH) blue-light-emitting diodes (LEDs) with the luminous intensity over 1 cd were fabricated. As an active layer, a Zn-doped InGaN layer was used for the DH LEDs. The typical output power was 1500 muW and the external <mark>quantum</mark> efficiency was as high as 2.7% at a forward current of 20 mA at room temperature. The peak wavelength and </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec193AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) and related spectroscopies are powered primarily by the concentration of the electromagnetic (EM) fields associated with light in or near appropriately nanostructured electrically-conducting materials, most prominently, but not exclusively high-conductivity metals such as silver and gold. This field concentration takes place on account of the excitatio</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button Reduced screening in two dimensions results in markedly enhanced electron-electron interactions, which have been predicted to generate giant bandgap renormalization and excitonic effects(10-13). Here we present a rigorous experimental observation of extraordin</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-3387&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE NANOTECHNOLOGY" data-ta="Sidenav-195-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-195-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 12 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.530-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec195AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>High-mobility semiconducting ultrathin films form the basis of modern electronics, and may lead to the scalable fabrication of highly performing devices. Because the ultrathin limit cannot be reached for traditional semiconductors, identifying new two-dimensional materials with both high carrier mobility and a large electronic bandgap is a pivotal goal of fundamental research(1-9). average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-3387&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE NANOTECHNOLOGY" data-ta="Sidenav-196-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-196-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 13 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (4) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.289-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec196AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Reduced dimensionality and interlayer coupling in van der Waals materials gives rise to fundamentally different electronic(1), optical(2) and many-body <mark>quantum</mark>(3-5) properties in monolayers compared with the bulk. This layer-dependence permits the discovery of novel material properties in the monolayer regime. Ferromagnetic order in two-dimensional materials is a coveted property that would all</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-197-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-197-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2211-2855&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO ENERGY" data-ta="Sidenav-197-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-197-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 59 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.644-650 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec197AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Herein, this work constructs a three-dimensional porous graphitic carbon nitride assembled by highly crystalline and ultrathin nanosheets (3D g-C3N4NS). 3D g-C3N4NS could directly split pure water into H-2 and O-2 with high evolution rate up to 101.4 and 49.1 mu mol g(-1) h(-1) under visible light, respectively, approximately 11.8 and 5.1 times higher than bulk g-C3N4 and g-C3N4NS. Besides, it </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-198-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-198-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-198-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-198-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 555 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7695) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.231-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec198AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Artificial superlattices, based on van der Waals heterostructures of two-dimensional atomic crystals such as graphene or molybdenum disulfide, offer technological opportunities beyond the reach of existing materials(1-3). Typical strategies for creating such artificial superlattices rely on arduous layer-by-layer exfoliation and restacking, with limited yield and reproducibility(4-8). The botto</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-199-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-199-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0021-9991&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF COMPUTATIONAL PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-199-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-199-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 378 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.686-707 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec199AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We introduce <mark>physics</mark>-informed neural networks - neural networks that are trained to solve supervised learning tasks while respecting any given laws of <mark>physics</mark> described by general nonlinear partial differential equations. In this work, we present our developments in the context of solving two main classes of problems: data-driven solution and data-driven discovery of partial differential equati</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-shi-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-200-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-200-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-shi-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0306-0012&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=CHEMICAL SOCIETY REVIEWS" data-ta="Sidenav-200-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-200-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-shi-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-shi-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 44 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (15) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.5638-5679 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec200AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Graphene is the thinnest two-dimensional (2D) carbon material and has many advantages including high carrier mobilities and conductivity, high optical transparency, excellent mechanical flexibility and chemical stability, which make graphene an ideal material for various optoelectronic devices. The major applications of graphene in photovoltaic devices are for transparent electrodes and charge </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - class="category-menu-switch-handler" role="tab" tabindex="-1" aria-selected="false" aria-controls="ot-desc-id-C0004"><h3 id="ot-header-id-C0004">Targeting Cookies</h3></div></li><li class="ot-cat-item ot-vs-config" role="presentation" data-optanongroupid="C0005"><div class="category-menu-switch-handler" role="tab" tabindex="-1" aria-selected="false" aria-controls="ot-desc-id-C0005"><h3 id="ot-header-id-C0005">Social Media Cookies</h3></div></li></ul></div><div class="ot-tab-desc ot-sdk-eight ot-sdk-columns"><div class="ot-desc-cntr" id="ot-tab-desc" tabindex="0" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="ot-pvcy-hdr"><h4 id="ot-pvcy-hdr">Your preferences</h4><p id="ot-pc-desc" class="ot-grp-desc">As described in our <a href="https://clarivate.com/privacy-center/notices-policies/privacy-policy/">Corporate Privacy Notice</a> and <a href="https://clarivate.com/privacy-center/notices-policies/cookie-policy/">Cookie Policy</a>, we use cookies (including pixels or other similar technologies) on our websites, mobile applications and related products  (the “services”).  The types of cookies we use are described below.​</p></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide ot-always-active-group" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-C0001"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Strictly Necessary Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"><div class="ot-always-active">Always Active</div></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc">These are cookies necessary for the services to function and are always active. They are usually only set in response to actions made by the user which amount to a request for services, such as setting privacy preferences, logging in, or filling in forms. ​</p></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-C0002"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Performance Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="ot-group-id-C0002" id="ot-group-id-C0002" aria-checked="true" role="switch" class="category-switch-handler" data-optanongroupid="C0002" checked="" aria-labelledby="ot-header-id-C0002"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-group-id-C0002"><span class="ot-switch-nob" aria-checked="false" role="switch"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Performance Cookies</span></label> </div><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc">These cookies count visits and traffic sources in order to measure and improve the performance of the services. They help identify which pages or functions within the services are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around our services.​</p></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-C0003"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Functional Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="ot-group-id-C0003" id="ot-group-id-C0003" aria-checked="true" role="switch" class="category-switch-handler" data-optanongroupid="C0003" checked="" aria-labelledby="ot-header-id-C0003"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-group-id-C0003"><span class="ot-switch-nob" aria-checked="false" role="switch"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Functional Cookies</span></label> </div><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc">These cookies enable the services to provide enhanced functionality and personalization. They may be set by us or by third party providers we use to provide the services. If you do not allow these cookies to run, then the services may not function properly.​</p></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-C0004"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Targeting Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="ot-group-id-C0004" id="ot-group-id-C0004" aria-checked="true" role="switch" class="category-switch-handler" data-optanongroupid="C0004" checked="" aria-labelledby="ot-header-id-C0004"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-group-id-C0004"><span class="ot-switch-nob" aria-checked="false" role="switch"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Targeting Cookies</span></label> </div><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc">These cookies may be set through the services by our advertising partners to learn about your interests and present you with relevant advertisements on other sites.  These advertising partners may be able to identify you based on your device or other online activity.​</p></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-C0005"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Social Media Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="ot-group-id-C0005" id="ot-group-id-C0005" aria-checked="true" role="switch" class="category-switch-handler" data-optanongroupid="C0005" checked="" aria-labelledby="ot-header-id-C0005"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-group-id-C0005"><span class="ot-switch-nob" aria-checked="false" role="switch"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Social Media Cookies</span></label> </div><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc">These cookies are used to enable social media sharing or “like” buttons on our services.  They also provide the ability to link your account or engage with our content on or through a social media platform such as Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn. These cookies may enable such platforms to track your online activity and interests. ​</p></div></div></div></div><!-- Vendors / Hosts --><section id="ot-pc-lst" class="ot-hide ot-enbl-chr"><div class="ot-lst-cntr ot-pc-scrollbar"><div id="ot-pc-hdr"><div id="ot-lst-title"><button class="ot-link-btn back-btn-handler" aria-label="Back"><svg id="ot-back-arw" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" x="0px" y="0px" viewBox="0 0 444.531 444.531" xml:space="preserve"><title>Back Button</title><g><path fill="#656565" d="M213.13,222.409L351.88,83.653c7.05-7.043,10.567-15.657,10.567-25.841c0-10.183-3.518-18.793-10.567-25.835
